â€¢ Ingredients(6(W)x2.7(L)x2.5(H) inch)
â–¡ 100g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 90g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 100g Eggs, at room temperature
â–¡ 100g Cake flour
â–¡ 15g Mugwort powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 3g Baking powder
â–¡ 30g Heavy cream, at room temperature

â—‡ Before You Start
â€¢ Take your butter, eggs, and heavy cream out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking
â€¢ Sift mugwort powder to filter its thick fibres before measuring

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the softened butter with sugar until light and fluffy
2. Add in a very small amount of the egg and beat after each addition
3. Sift together cake flour, mugwort powder, salt, and baking powder into the butter mixture
4. Mix until the dry ingredients are just combined(You can add some milk(10ml) if the batter is too stiff)
5. Stir in heavy cream
6. Place the batter into a greased cake pan
7. Using a spatula, make a concave surface
8. Pipe a vertical line of butter in the middle of the cake batter or score the top of the cake with a knife
9. Bake for 40 min at 340Â°F
10. Tap the cake pan on the countertop several times and take the cake out of the pan to cool completely
11. Top with a dollop of whipped cream
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(Yields: 6 ğŸƒmuffins)
+ For the Muffins
â–¡ 105g Cake flour
â–¡ 1/4tsp Baking powder
â–¡ 1/4tsp Baking soda
â–¡ 1/4tsp Salt
â–¡ 1/4tsp Cinnamon powder
â–¡ 1 large egg
â–¡ 60g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 60ml Vegetable oil
â–¡ 1/2tsp Vanilla extract
â–¡ 30g Milk
â–¡ 100g Sweet pumpkins
â–¡ Candied sweet pumpkinsğŸƒ

+ Candied Sweet PumpkinsğŸƒ
â–¡ 100g Sweet pumpkin pieces
â–¡ 10g Unsalted butter
â–¡ 10g Granulated sugar

+ For the Cream Cheese Frosting
â–¡ 120g Cream cheese, at room temperature
â–¡ 120g Heavy cream, cold
â–¡ 30g Granulated sugar
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ Instructions 
+ To make the muffins
1. In a pan, add pumpkin pieces, unsalted butter, and sugar
2. Bring to a simmer over low heat and stir until pumpkin is tender(Candied sweet pumpkins)
3. In a bowl, whisk an egg, sugar, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, milk, and mashed sweet pumpkins
4. Sift together cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon powder over the pumpkin mixture
5. Whisk until well combined
6. Gently stir in the cooled candied sweet pumpkins
7. Fill muffin cups about 2/3 full
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 355 Â°F
9. Let muffins cool in the pan for 5 min and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

+ To make the cream cheese frosting
1. Whisk the cream cheese until smooth
2. In a bowl, add cold heavy cream and sugar
3. Whisk on high speed until stiff peaks form
4. Gently mix whipped heavy cream and the softened cream cheese until combined

â€¢ Ingredients(10 madeleines)
â–¡ 1 Egg(55g), at room temperature
â–¡ 55g Sugar
â–¡ 10g Honey
â–¡ 65g Cake flour
â–¡ 15g Sweet pumpkin powder
â–¡ 3g Baking powder
â–¡ 60g Unsalted butter, melted(120~140Â°F)
â–¡ 15g Milk
â–¡ **Candied sweet pumpkinsğŸƒ(for topping)
â–¡ 30g Cream cheese(for topping)

**Candied sweet pumpkinsğŸƒ
â–¡ 60g Sweet pumpkins
â–¡ 20g Granulated sugar 
â–¡ 30g Water

â€¢ Before you start, you need to make candied sweet pumpkins

**To make candied sweet pumpkins
1. In a pan, put chopped pumpkins, sugar, and water.
2. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat and stir occasionally until pumpkin is tender
3. Remove from the heat and let cool in a bowl

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the egg with sugar and honey until combined
2. Sift cake flour, sweet pumpkin powder, and baking powder together
3. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture until just incorporated
4. Whisk in the melted butter and milk until smooth
5. Cover the batter with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour
(During the last few minutes of chilling, grease the moulds with melted butter and preheat the oven to 360Â°F)
6. After chilling, stir the batter with a spatula
7. Transfer the batter to a pastry bag
8. Fill the moulds until 2/3 full
9. Put some candied sweet pumpkins and cream cheese on top
9. Bake for 10-12 min at 355Â°F until edges are golden brown
10. Gently loosen the madeleines from the moulds
11. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 8 macarons)
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 46g almond flour 
â–¡ 44g powdered sugar
â–¡ 35g egg whites
â–¡ 35g granulated sugar
â–¡ Black food colouring(Wilton Black)

For the Filling:
â–¡ 60g CrÃ¨me Anglaise
â–¡ 9g Black sesame paste
â–¡ 7g powdered black sesame
â–¡ Black sesame rice cake

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Add black gel food colouring and mix well
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 0.4-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 1.4-inch circles
10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 30 minutes
13. Bake for 13 minutes at 302â„‰ *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size

To Make the Filling:
1. Put black sesame paste and powder into the CrÃ¨me Anglaise and mix well
2. Pipe the buttercream round the perimeter of the macaron, leaving the centre empty
3. Put a black sesame rice cake into the centre
4. Refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: about 30 cookies)

â–¡ 1 Egg yolk, at room temperature

â–¡ Purple sweet potato powder
â–¡ Black sesame

â€¢ Before you start
Take butter and eggs out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking

â€¢ Instructions
1. Mash boiled sweet potatoes with a masher and cool to room temperature
2. Beat the butter until smooth and whisk in powdered sugar until light and fluffy
3. Add mashed sweet potatoes, eggs and vanilla extract and mix well
4. Sift the dry ingredients into the butter mixture and mix until just combined
5. knead a couple of times just to bring it together
6. Roll into a log, about 1.5-inches in diameter

9. Slice the dough into 1/3â€³ thick

12. Bake for 13-15 min at 340Â°F
13. Let sit on the pan for 3 min and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

â–¡ 1g Salt

â€¢ Before you start
Takd your butter and eggs out of the fridge an hour before using

â€¢ Instructions 
1. Cream together softened butter and powdered sugar
2. Add an egg yolk and vanilla extract until just incorporated
3. Sift together cake flour, almond powder, and salt into the butter mixture
4. Mix until the dry ingredients are just incorporated
5. Stir in chopped dried cranberries and knead the dough a few times(Do not overwork)
6. Roll into a log, about 1.5-inches in diameter
7. Place dough on a sheet of parchment paper and tightly roll up the dough
8. Freeze for an hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375Â°F
9. Remove from the freezer and unwrap
10. Slice the dough into 1/3â€³ thick and place on prepared baking sheets(These cookies donâ€™t spread when baking)
11. Bake for 15 min at 355Â°F
12. Let cool on the pan for 5 min, and then transfer to a wire rack
13. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(10 madeleines)
ğŸ‹ For the honey lemon madeleines
â–¡ 75g Eggs, at room temperature
â–¡ 60g Sugar
â–¡ Lemon zest(zest of one whole lemon)
â–¡ 20g Honey
â–¡ 60g Cake flour
â–¡ 15g Almond powder
â–¡ 3g Baking powder
â–¡ 72g Unsalted butter, melted(about 120Â°F)
â–¡ 15g Lemon juice

ğŸ‹ For the lemon glaze
â–¡ 45g Powdered sugar
â–¡ 10g Lemon juice
â–¡ 4g Water

â€¢ Before you start:  
Take out your eggs out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the eggs with lemon sugar and honey until combined(Do not overmix)
2. Sift cake flour, almond powder and baking powder together
3. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture until just incorporated
4. Whisk in the melted butter and lemon juice until smooth
5. Cover the batter with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour
(During the last few minutes of chilling, preheat the oven to 360Â°F)
6. After chilling, stir the batter with a spatula
7. Transfer the batter to a pastry bag
8. Fill the moulds to 80-90% full
9. Bake for 10-12 min at 355Â°F
10. Gently loosen the madeleines from the moulds
11. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely
12. In a small bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, lemon juice, and water
13. Brush the lemon glaze over the cooled madeleines
14. Put the pan in the oven(at 340Â°F) for a minute and then remove from the oven
15. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(10 madeleines)
â–¡ 1 Egg(55g), at room temperature
â–¡ 55g Sugar
â–¡ 10g Honey
â–¡ 65g Cake flour
â–¡ 15g Sweet pumpkin powder
â–¡ 3g Baking powder
â–¡ 60g Unsalted butter, melted(120~140Â°F)
â–¡ 15g Milk
â–¡ **Candied sweet pumpkinsğŸƒ(for topping)
â–¡ 30g Cream cheese(for topping)

**Candied sweet pumpkinsğŸƒ
â–¡ 60g Sweet pumpkins
â–¡ 20g Granulated sugar 
â–¡ 30g Water

â€¢ Before you start, you need to make candied sweet pumpkins

**To make candied sweet pumpkins
1. In a pan, put chopped pumpkins, sugar, and water.
2. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat and stir occasionally until pumpkin is tender
3. Remove from the heat and let cool in a bowl

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the egg with sugar and honey until combined
2. Sift cake flour, sweet pumpkin powder, and baking powder together
3. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture until just incorporated
4. Whisk in the melted butter and milk until smooth
5. Cover the batter with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour
(During the last few minutes of chilling, grease the moulds with melted butter and preheat the oven to 360Â°F)
6. After chilling, stir the batter with a spatula
7. Transfer the batter to a pastry bag
8. Fill the moulds until 2/3 full
9. Put some candied sweet pumpkins and cream cheese on top
9. Bake for 10-12 min at 355Â°F until edges are golden brown
10. Gently loosen the madeleines from the moulds
11. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: 10 madeleines)
ğŸµ For the Matcha Madeleines 
â–¡ 20g White chocolate 
â–¡ 70g Eggs, at room temp 
â–¡ 65g Granulated sugar 
â–¡ 45g Cake flour 
â–¡ 25g Almond powder 
â–¡ 6g Matcha powder 
â–¡ 3g Baking powder 
â–¡ 62g Unsalted butter, melted 
â–¡ 15g Heavy cream, at room temp

ğŸµ For the Matcha Glaze 
â–¡ 63g Powdered sugar 
â–¡ 2g Matcha powder 
â–¡ 15ml Water
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ Before you start
Take eggs and heavy cream out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking
--------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ Instructions
1. Melt white chocolate in a double boiler(about 100Â°F)
2. Beat the eggs with sugar until combined(Do not overmix)
3. Sift cake flour, almond powder, matcha powder and baking powder together
4. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture until just incorporated
5. Whisk in the melted butter(105-120Â°F), melted white chocolate, and heavy cream until smooth
6. Cover the batter with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour
(During the last few minutes of chilling, preheat the oven to 360Â°F and butter the moulds)
7. After chilling, stir the batter with a spatula
8. Transfer the batter to a pastry bag
9. Fill the moulds to 80-90% full
10. Bake for 10-12 min at 355Â°F
11. Gently loosen the madeleines from the moulds
12. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely
13. In a small bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, matcha powder, and water
14. Brush the matcha glaze over the cooled madeleines
15. Put the pan in the oven(at 340Â°F) for a minute and then remove from the oven
16. Enjoy!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

â€¢ Ingredients(10 madeleines)
â–¡ 80g Eggs, at room temperature
â–¡ 60g Sugar
â–¡ 10g Honey
â–¡ 45g Cake flour
â–¡ 20g Almond powder
â–¡ 25g Cocoa powder
â–¡ 3g Baking powder
â–¡ 70g Unsalted butter, melted(120~140Â°F)
â–¡ 25g Heavy cream, at room temperature

â–¡ 80g Dark chocolateğŸ«, for coating

â€¢ Before you start
- Take your eggs and heavy cream out of the fridge an hour before using

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the eggs with sugar and honey until combined
2. Sift cake flour, almond powder, cocoa powder, and baking powder together
3. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture until just incorporated
4. Whisk in the melted butter and heavy cream until smooth
5. Cover the batter with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour
(During the last few minutes of chilling, preheat the oven to 360Â°F)
6. After chilling, stir the batter with a spatula
7. Transfer the batter to a pastry bag
8. Fill the moulds to 80-90% full
9. Put some cacao nibs on top
9. Bake for 10-12 min at 355Â°F
10. Gently loosen the madeleines from the moulds
11. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely
12. Melt dark chocolate in a double boiler(about 130Â°F)
13. Pipe the melted chocolate into the moulds and place the cooled madeleines in the moulds
14. Put in the freezer for 30 minutes to set
16. Gently loosen the madeleines from the moulds
17. Enjoy!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hi, guys! It's Bunnify! 
Today I'm making "potato" bread, which is so popular in Korea these days! These look just like real potatoes! Mochi-like chewy outside, soft inside, stuffed with mashed potato filling and cheese! 
You can substitute pine soft t with tapioca starch. It's hard to find pine soft 202 and pine soft C overseas. Add the same amount of bread flour instead of pine soft 202. And you don't have to use pine soft C if you don't have one, but instead of that, reduce the amount of milk from 90ml to 70ml.

Thank you for watching!

â€¢ Please translate into your language :) Thank you!
http://www.youtube.com/timedtext_video?v=xcLsgCvXUpQ&ref=share

 â€¢ Ingredients(yields:6-7)
â–  For the doughğŸ¥”
â–¡ 200g Pine soft T(or tapioca starch)
â–¡ 30g Pine soft 202
â–¡ 30g Pine soft C
â–¡ 20g Glutinous rice flour
â–¡ 1 Egg, at room temp(52~55g)
â–¡ 90ml Milk, at room temp(Add more if the dough is too thick)
â–¡ 20g Corn syrup
â–¡ 3g Salt
â–¡ 10g Vegetable oil
â–¡ 50g Unsalted butter, at room temp
â–¡ 30g Soybean powder
â–¡ 3g Black sesame powder

â–  For the potato fillingğŸ¥”
â–¡ 2 Potatoes(350~380g)
â–¡ 30g Unsalted butter, at room temp
â–¡ 10-30ml Milk, at room temp
â–¡ 25g Mayonnaise
â–¡ 12g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 2~3 String cheese

Leftovers can be kept in the freezer and reheated in the oven or microwave before serving.

Hi, it's Bunnify!

Today, I'm going to show you how to make snow-white dinner rolls. The texture is very soft and more moist than other dinner rolls. 
To make the crust white, you need to bake a little longer at lower temperature than usual dinner rolls. (Baking temperature and time vary depending on your oven. You may need to bake longer/shorter or at higher/lower temperature.)
It's very soft right after it's baked. Be careful when you remove your bread from the pan.
If you like a light and not-sweet flavor, you can just eat it. But I think it's more delicious if you spread some jam on it.
I put the detailed explanation in the video.

Hi, It's Bunnifyâ™¡

Today, I'm going to show you how to make soft and fluffy sweet pumpkin dinner rolls.
Be sure to drain boiled pumpkin before adding to the dough. If the dough is too thick, add a little more milk. If the dough is already too sticky, add more bread flour.

I cooked 150g of chopped sweet pumpkin in a microwave, and pat-dried with paper towels. And then placed in the fridge overnight. I used it the next day. Its weight was 60 grams.

I put the detailed explanation in the video.
Thank you for watching!

â€¢ Notes
- I divided the dough into 9 pieces, and each piece weighed about 52g. There was some dough left over. So I made a small dinner roll with it.(7:49)
- Cinnamon powder or nutmeg can be omitted depending on your preference, but I recommend you to use it for a nice fragrance.
----------------------------------------------------------------------

â€¢ Ingredients(6.5-inch square pan)
â–¡ 260g Bread flour
â–¡ 10g Non-fat dry milk
â–¡ 35g Muscovado sugar(light brown sugar)
â–¡ 4g Instant dry yeast
â–¡ 3g Salt
â–¡ 1g Cinnamon powder, optional
â–¡ Pinch of nutmeg, optional
â–¡ 52g Eggs
â–¡ 50g(plus more if needed) Milk
â–¡ 60g Boiled sweet pumpkin, drained
â–¡ 20g Unsalted butter, softened
â–¡ Melted butter, for brushing

â€¢ Before you start
Take your butter out of the fridge an hour before using
Line the pan with parchment paper

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: 20~35 Cookies)
â–¡ 75g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 55g Powdered Sugar
â–¡ 23g Eggs, at room temperature
â–¡ 1/4tsp(1g) Vanilla Extract
â–¡ 1/8tsp(0.75g) Salt
â–¡ 120g Cake Flour
â–¡ 35g Almond powder
â–¡ 5g Cocoa powder
â–¡ 5g Matcha powder

â€¢ Before you start
Take butter and eggs out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the butter until smooth and whisk in powdered sugar
2. Add in eggs, vanilla extract and salt and mix until combined
3. Sift together cake flour and almond powder into the butter mixture
4. Transfer half of the dough to another bowl
5. Add in cocoa powder/matcha powder and knead the dough until well combined
6. Put each dough into a zipper bag and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes
7. Roll out the dough into 1/8-1/6-inch thickness
8. Cut out with a cookie cutter and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet
9. Bake for 10-12 min at 340Â°F
10. Let cool on the pan for 5 min and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely
11. Decorate with chocolate pens or sprinkles
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: 10-12 linzer cookies(2-inch))
â–¡ 60g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 40g Powdered sugar
â–¡ 1 Egg yolk
â–¡ 1/4tsp Vanilla extract
â–¡ 100g Cake flour
â–¡ 20g Almond powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 1g Cinnamon powder(optional)
â–¡ Strawberry jamğŸ“, for filling
â–¡ Powdered sugar, for dusting

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the butter with powdered sugar until fluffy
2. Whisk in an egg yolk and vanilla extract
3. Sift together cake flour, almond powder, salt, and cinnamon powder into the butter mixture
4. Mix until just combined and knead the dough until it comes together
5. Put the dough in the zipper bag and chill in the fridge for an hour(During the last few minutes of chilling, preheat the oven to 350Â°F)
6. Roll out dough into 1/8 to 1/6-inch thickness
7. Cut out with a 2" cookie cutter and place the cookies on a parchment-lined baking sheet
8. Using a smaller cookie cutter, cut out the centres of half of the cookies
9. Bake for 10-12 min at 340Â°F
10. Let cookies cool for 5 min on the pan and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely
11. Dust the tops of cookies with powdered sugar

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings:18~20 Cookies)
â–¡ 60g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 20g Powdered Sugar
â–¡ 1/4tsp Vanilla Extract
â–¡ A pinch of Salt
â–¡ 70g All-purpose Flour
â–¡ 35g Pecans
â–¡ Powdered Sugar(for rolling)

â€¢ Before you start
Take butter out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking
Preheat the oven to 340Â°F

â€¢ Instructions
1. Toast the pecans in the oven preheated to 340Â°F for 5-10 min
2. Allow the toasted pecans to cool completely and chop them
3. Beat the butter until smooth and whisk in powdered sugar
4. Add in vanilla extract and salt and mix well
5. Sift flour into the butter mixture and mix until just combined
6. Stir in the chopped pecans
7. Chill the dough in the fridge for 45 min
8. After chilling, shape dough into 1-inch balls
9. Bake for 17-20 min at 340Â°F
10. Roll in powdered sugar while cookies are still warm
11. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely
12. Roll in the powdered sugar once again 
13. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: 22 cookiesğŸª(1.5" square))
â–¡ 100g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 45g Powdered sugar
â–¡ 1 Egg yolk, at room temperature
â–¡ 1/8tsp Vanilla extract(Optional)
â–¡ 120g Cake flour
â–¡ 45g Almond powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 45g Dried Cranberries

â€¢ Before you start
Takd your butter and eggs out of the fridge an hour before using

â€¢ Instructions 
1. Cream together softened butter and powdered sugar
2. Add an egg yolk and vanilla extract until just incorporated
3. Sift together cake flour, almond powder, and salt into the butter mixture
4. Mix until the dry ingredients are just incorporated
5. Stir in chopped dried cranberries and knead the dough a few times(Do not overwork)
6. Roll into a log, about 1.5-inches in diameter
7. Place dough on a sheet of parchment paper and tightly roll up the dough
8. Freeze for an hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375Â°F
9. Remove from the freezer and unwrap
10. Slice the dough into 1/3â€³ thick and place on prepared baking sheets(These cookies donâ€™t spread when baking)
11. Bake for 15 min at 355Â°F
12. Let cool on the pan for 5 min, and then transfer to a wire rack
13. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings:6~8 muffins)

ğŸ„ For the Red Velvet Muffins

â–¡ 80g Unsalted butter, at room temperature

â–¡ 90g Granulated sugar

â–¡ 65g Eggs, at room temperature

â–¡ 1/4tsp(1g) Vanilla extract

â–¡ 105g Cake flour

â–¡ 22~25g Red yeast rice flour

â–¡ 3g Cocoa powder

â–¡ 2g Baking powder

â–¡ 1g Baking soda

â–¡ 1/8tsp(0.75g) Salt

â–¡ 110ml milk, at room temperature



ğŸ„ For the Cream Cheese Frosting

â–¡ 100g Cream cheese, at room temperature

â–¡ 150g Heavy cream, cold

â–¡ 35g Granulated sugar



â€¢ Before you start

Take butter, eggs, milk, and cream cheese out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking



â€¢ Instructions

1. Beat the butter until smooth and creamy

2. Whisk in granulated sugar until light and fluffy

3. Add the eggs little by little, beating after each addition

4. Add in vanilla extract and mix well

5. Sift the dry ingredients into the butter mixture and mix until just combined

6. Add milk little by little, mixing after each addition

7. Fill muffin cups about 2/3 to 3/4 full

8. Bake for 20-25 min at 340Â°F

9. Let cool on the pan for 3 min and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

10. Beat the cream cheese until smooth

11. Put heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whisk until hard peaks form

12. Fold the whipped cream into the cream cheese until combined

13. Pipe the cream cheese frosting on top of the cooled muffins

14. Sprinkle with the muffin crumbs

15. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: 20~35 Cookies)
â–¡ 75g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 55g Powdered Sugar
â–¡ 23g Eggs, at room temperature
â–¡ 1/4tsp(1g) Vanilla Extract
â–¡ 1/8tsp(0.75g) Salt
â–¡ 120g Cake Flour
â–¡ 35g Almond powder
â–¡ 5g Cocoa powder
â–¡ 5g Matcha powder

â€¢ Before you start
Take butter and eggs out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the butter until smooth and whisk in powdered sugar
2. Add in eggs, vanilla extract and salt and mix until combined
3. Sift together cake flour and almond powder into the butter mixture
4. Transfer half of the dough to another bowl
5. Add in cocoa powder/matcha powder and knead the dough until well combined
6. Put each dough into a zipper bag and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes
7. Roll out the dough into 1/8-1/6-inch thickness
8. Cut out with a cookie cutter and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet
9. Bake for 10-12 min at 340Â°F
10. Let cool on the pan for 5 min and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely
11. Decorate with chocolate pens or sprinkles
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: 22 cookiesğŸª(1.5" square))

â–¡ 45g Almond powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 45g Dried Cranberries

â€¢ Before you start
Takd your butter and eggs out of the fridge an hour before using

â€¢ Instructions 
1. Cream together softened butter and powdered sugar
2. Add an egg yolk and vanilla extract until just incorporated
3. Sift together cake flour, almond powder, and salt into the butter mixture
4. Mix until the dry ingredients are just incorporated
5. Stir in chopped dried cranberries and knead the dough a few times(Do not overwork)
6. Roll into a log, about 1.5-inches in diameter
7. Place dough on a sheet of parchment paper and tightly roll up the dough
8. Freeze for an hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375Â°F
9. Remove from the freezer and unwrap
10. Slice the dough into 1/3â€³ thick and place on prepared baking sheets(These cookies donâ€™t spread when baking)
11. Bake for 15 min at 355Â°F
12. Let cool on the pan for 5 min, and then transfer to a wire rack
13. Enjoy!

â–¡ 100g Cake flour
â–¡ 7g Cocoa powder

â€¢ Instructions

2. Sift together flour and matcha/cocoa powder into the butter mixture
3. With a spatula, mix until the dry ingredients are just incorporated
4. Stir in Maltesers or chocolate chips until combined
5. Scoop the dough using a 1.5-inch diameter ice cream scoop
6. Place the dough 2 inches apart on prepared baking sheet(Cookies donâ€™t spread much when baking)
7. Bake for 15-18 min at 320Â°F
8. Remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the pan for 5 minutes before moving to a wire rack to cool completely
9. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(6(W)x2.7(L)x2.5(H) inch)
â–¡ 100g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 90g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 100g Eggs, at room temperature
â–¡ 100g Cake flour
â–¡ 15g Mugwort powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 3g Baking powder
â–¡ 30g Heavy cream, at room temperature

â—‡ Before You Start
â€¢ Take your butter, eggs, and heavy cream out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking
â€¢ Sift mugwort powder to filter its thick fibres before measuring

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the softened butter with sugar until light and fluffy
2. Add in a very small amount of the egg and beat after each addition
3. Sift together cake flour, mugwort powder, salt, and baking powder into the butter mixture
4. Mix until the dry ingredients are just combined(You can add some milk(10ml) if the batter is too stiff)
5. Stir in heavy cream
6. Place the batter into a greased cake pan
7. Using a spatula, make a concave surface
8. Pipe a vertical line of butter in the middle of the cake batter or score the top of the cake with a knife
9. Bake for 40 min at 340Â°F
10. Tap the cake pan on the countertop several times and take the cake out of the pan to cool completely
11. Top with a dollop of whipped cream
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 3-inch 6~7 cookiesğŸª)
â–¡ 60g Unsalted butter, melted(Let cool to lukewarm before using)
â–¡ 75g Light brown sugar
â–¡ 1/2 eggs(about 27g), at room temperature
â–¡ 1/2tsp Vanilla extract
â–¡ 95g All-purpose flour
â–¡ 10g Cocoa powder
â–¡ 3g Baking soda
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 50g Dark chocolate chips
â–¡ M&Mâ€™s

â€¢ Instructions 
1. In a mixing bowl, mix together melted butter and sugar
2. Beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
3. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt
4. Add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture and stir until just combined
5. Stir in dark chocolate chips
6. Cover the dough with plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for 1 hour
7. Scoop the dough using a 2-inch diameter ice cream scoop
8. Place the dough 2 inches apart on prepared baking sheet
9. Press down slightly on the dough and top with chocolate chips and M&Mâ€™s
10. Bake at 350Â°F for about 10-12 minutes
11. Let sit on the pan for about 5 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings: 20-25 cookiesğŸª(1.5" square))

â€¢ Before you start
Take butter and eggs out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the butter until smooth and creamy
2. Whisk in powdered sugar until light and fluffy
3. Add in the egg yolk and vanilla extract and mix well
4. Sift together cake flour and cocoa powder into the butter mixture and mix until just combined
5. Stir in sliced almonds
6. Knead the dough a few times(Do not overwork)
7. Roll into a log, about 1.5-inches in diameter
8. Place dough on a sheet of parchment paper and tightly roll up the dough
9. Freeze for an hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375Â°F
10. Remove from the freezer and unwrap
11. Slice the dough into 1/3â€³ thick and place on prepared baking sheets(These cookies donâ€™t spread when baking)
12. Bake for 15 min at 355Â°F
13. Let cool on the pan for 5 min, and then transfer to a wire rack
14. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(makes about 25 cookies)
â–¡ 100g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 40g Powdered sugar
â–¡ 1 Egg yolk, at room temperature
â–¡ 125g Cake flour
â–¡ 30g Almond powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 2g Earl Grey tea leaves(1 teabag)
â–¡ Egg whites & sugar, for decorating

â€¢ Instructions 
1. Cream together softened butter and powdered sugar
2. Add an egg yolk and beat until just incorporated
3. Sift the dry ingredients into the butter mixture
4. Mix until the dry ingredients are just incorporated
5. Knead the dough a few times(Do not overwork)
6. Roll into a log, about 1.2-inches in diameter
7. Place dough on a sheet of parchment paper and tightly roll up the dough
8. Freeze for an hour. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375Â°F
9. Remove from the freezer and unwrap
10. Brush with egg white to adhere the sugar and roll the logs in sugar
11. Slice the dough into 1/3â€³ thick and place on baking sheets, 1-2 inches apart
12. Bake for 15-18 min at 355Â°F
13. Let cool on the pan for 5 min, and then transfer to a wire rack
14. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(makes batch of 2 trays)
- For the carrot cake:

50g powdered sugar
30g heavy cream

- Optional additions:
Walnuts, chopped
Cinnamon powder
Rosemary

â€¢ Instructions 
- To make the carrot cake:
1. Mix eggs, vegetable oil, soaked carrot chips, walnut and premix in a bowl and whisk until there are no lumps
2. Spread the cake mixture into the folded trays
3. Bake the trays in an oven(170, for 20-25 minutes) or in a 1,000W microwave(3 minutes 30 seconds)
4. Cool on a wire rack to serve
- To make the cream cheese frosting:
1. Beat softened cream cheese and butter until smooth and creamy
2. Add powdered sugar and heavy cream and mix until it gets fluffy
3. Top with chopped walnuts, cinnamon powder, and rosemary.

â€¢ Ingredients
2 eggs, at room temperature
140g Unsalted butter, melted
Brownie mix(mix+sugar+dark chocolate chips)
3Tsp marshmallow fluff
Powdered sugar, for dusting
Sprinkles

â€¢ Directions
1. Fold the baking trays
2. In a bowl, add in eggs, melted butter, sugar, the brownie mix and dark chocolate chips
3. Whisk until there are no lumps
4. Pour the mixture into the folded tray
5. Spread the batter evenly into the edges using a spatula
6. Microwave for 2 minutes 30 seconds(700W)
7. Let the brownies cool completely
8. Cut out round-shaped brownies with cookie cutters
9. Cut out a star with a star-shaped cookie cutter
10. Microwave fluff for 20-30 seconds to melt it slightly
11. Put the largest round onto a plate and spread fluff over the top
12. Repeat adding smaller-sized rounds with fluff
13. Dust the tree cake with powdered sugar
14. Decorate the cake with sprinkles

â€¢ Servings: 16 square pieces
â€¢ Total time: 100 min

â€¢ This set includes:
100g dark chocolate
10g cocoa powder, for dusting
1 paper ribbon
1 gift box

â€¢ You need to prepare:
4 Tbsp heavy cream
1 tsp liqueur of your choice, optional
Hot water, at 176Â°F

â€¢ Before you start
1. Heat the water to 176Â°F
2. Fold the gift box
â€¢ Make sure that the bowls and utensils are perfectly dry

â€¢ Instructions
1. Pour the heavy cream into a bowl and place it over hot water at 176Â°F
2. Add the chocolate into the heated cream and stir until melted
3. Put the chocolate into the cold water bath and stir until creamy
4. Add liqueur of your choice and mix until combined
5. Pour the mixture into the baking tray and smooth the surface
6. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm
7. Remove the chocolate from the baking tray
8. Sift cocoa powder onto the tray
9. Cut the excess chocolate around the edges
(Warm up the knife with hot water and dry with a towel)
10. Cut the chocolate into 4 strips and cut them into cubes
11. Roll the chocolate using chopsticks to coat with cocoa powder
12. Put the chocolate in a box as a gift
13. Tie the box with a paper ribbon
14. Store in refrigerator up to 1 week

â€¢ Instructions 
1. In a sauce pan, combine water and sugar over low heat
2. Simmer over medium heat without stirring until the sugar is melted
3. Remove the pan from the heat when the sugar turns into medium-dark amber
4. Carefully pour in heated heavy cream, stirring constantly
5. Add in butter and stir until it's completely melted
6. Place in a sterilized bottle and leave in a refrigerator(Refrigerate up to 1 month in an airtight container)

Baking soda(for sterilizing)
2 Tbsp White vinegar(for sterilizing)
Hot water(for sterilizing)

* Use an equal amount of sugar to the lemon (1:1 ratio)

â€¢ Instructions 
1. To remove any chemical residues on the skin, scrub with baking soda or coarse salt and rinse with water
2. Let the lemons sit in a vinegar-water bath for 10 minutes
3. Let stand in hot water just for a little while to remove the waxy coating outside
4. Rinse well and pat dry with paper towels
5. Slice the lemons very thinly and remove all the seeds
6. Mix lemon slices with sugar, and pack them in sterilized glass jars
7. Let them sit on a room temperature for 1-2 days
8. Refrigerate the syrup once the jar is opened
9. Make hot lemon tea or iced lemonade

â€¢ Ingredients(150ml glass jarx2) 
250g strawberries *1:1 ratio of strawberries and sugar
250g granulated sugar
1L water
2Tbsp white vinegar
2Tbsp lemon juice

â€¢ Directions
1. Fill a large bowl with cool water and put strawberries into it
2. Add some white vinegar to the water for sterilizing
3. Let the berries sit in a vinegar-water bath for 2 minutes
4. Drain and rinse under running water
5. Place the berries on a paper towel and let them dry
6. Remove the stems from the berries
7. Mash the berries with a fork
8. Add granulated sugar and lemon juice into the berries and mix well
9. Put the syrup into a glass bowl and seal it
10. Keep the syrup in the fridge and use it within a week or two
11. Serve over waffles, pancakes, or ice cream, or swirl in syrup into milk(more or less, depending on desired sweetness)

â€¢ Ingredients(yield: 6 muffins)
â–·For the muffins:
1 1/2 ripe bananas
1 egg, at room temperature
55g melted butter/vegetable oil
55g granulated sugar
20g milk
1/2tsp vanilla extract
108g cake flour
1/2tsp baking powder
1/4tsp baking soda
1/4tsp salt
1/4tsp cinnamon powder 
70~90g chocolate chips/chunks
20g chopped walnuts(optional)

â–·For the frosting(basic&chocolate buttercream):
 85g unsalted butter, softened
 130g powdered sugar 
30g heavy cream
 3g cocoa powder
1/2 banana, sliced, for garnish
 sweets(optional)

â€¢ Directions
1. In a bowl, mash ripe bananas with a fork
2. Add in eggs, melted butter, sugar, and vanilla extract and whisk to combine
3. Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon powder and mix until just combined
4. Pour in chocolate chips and mix until combined
5. Line muffin tin with muffin liners and distribute batter evenly among 6 muffin cups, filling the cups 3/4 full
6. Bake at 180 ÂºC (356ÂºF) for 20-25 minutes, until toothpick poked in center muffin comes out clean. ) *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have
7. To make the buttercream, beat the butter until smooth
8. Mix in the powdered sugar and heavy cream until smooth and creamy
9. Frost the cooled cupcakes and top with sweets as desired

â€¢ Ingredients(Yields: 6 ğŸƒmuffins)
+ For the Muffins
â–¡ 105g Cake flour
â–¡ 1/4tsp Baking powder
â–¡ 1/4tsp Baking soda
â–¡ 1/4tsp Salt
â–¡ 1/4tsp Cinnamon powder
â–¡ 1 large egg
â–¡ 60g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 60ml Vegetable oil
â–¡ 1/2tsp Vanilla extract
â–¡ 30g Milk
â–¡ 100g Sweet pumpkins
â–¡ Candied sweet pumpkinsğŸƒ

+ Candied Sweet PumpkinsğŸƒ
â–¡ 100g Sweet pumpkin pieces
â–¡ 10g Unsalted butter
â–¡ 10g Granulated sugar

+ For the Cream Cheese Frosting
â–¡ 120g Cream cheese, at room temperature
â–¡ 120g Heavy cream, cold
â–¡ 30g Granulated sugar
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ Instructions 
+ To make the muffins
1. In a pan, add pumpkin pieces, unsalted butter, and sugar
2. Bring to a simmer over low heat and stir until pumpkin is tender(Candied sweet pumpkins)
3. In a bowl, whisk an egg, sugar, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, milk, and mashed sweet pumpkins
4. Sift together cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon powder over the pumpkin mixture
5. Whisk until well combined
6. Gently stir in the cooled candied sweet pumpkins
7. Fill muffin cups about 2/3 full
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 355 Â°F
9. Let muffins cool in the pan for 5 min and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

+ To make the cream cheese frosting
1. Whisk the cream cheese until smooth
2. In a bowl, add cold heavy cream and sugar
3. Whisk on high speed until stiff peaks form
4. Gently mix whipped heavy cream and the softened cream cheese until combined

â€¢ Instructions

â€¢ Ingredients(Servings:6~8 muffins)

ğŸ„ For the Red Velvet Muffins

â–¡ 80g Unsalted butter, at room temperature

â–¡ 90g Granulated sugar

â–¡ 65g Eggs, at room temperature

â–¡ 1/4tsp(1g) Vanilla extract

â–¡ 105g Cake flour

â–¡ 22~25g Red yeast rice flour

â–¡ 3g Cocoa powder

â–¡ 2g Baking powder

â–¡ 1g Baking soda

â–¡ 1/8tsp(0.75g) Salt

â–¡ 110ml milk, at room temperature



ğŸ„ For the Cream Cheese Frosting

â–¡ 100g Cream cheese, at room temperature

â–¡ 150g Heavy cream, cold

â–¡ 35g Granulated sugar



â€¢ Before you start

Take butter, eggs, milk, and cream cheese out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking



â€¢ Instructions

1. Beat the butter until smooth and creamy

2. Whisk in granulated sugar until light and fluffy

3. Add the eggs little by little, beating after each addition

4. Add in vanilla extract and mix well

5. Sift the dry ingredients into the butter mixture and mix until just combined

6. Add milk little by little, mixing after each addition

7. Fill muffin cups about 2/3 to 3/4 full

8. Bake for 20-25 min at 340Â°F

9. Let cool on the pan for 3 min and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

10. Beat the cream cheese until smooth

11. Put heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whisk until hard peaks form

12. Fold the whipped cream into the cream cheese until combined

13. Pipe the cream cheese frosting on top of the cooled muffins

14. Sprinkle with the muffin crumbs

15. Enjoy!

Hi, there! It's Bunnify!

Today, I'm going to make milk steamed cupcakes.
They're soft, fluffy, and spongy. Extremely easy to make!
I think it's a great afternoon-snack and perfect substitute for breakfast.
I made it in the afternoon and heated it up the next morning. It was as delicious as it was right after it was finished. :D 
I recommend eating it with a glass of milk. 
Try it today!

I put the detailed explanation in the video.
Thank you for watching!
----------------------------------------------------------------------

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 4 cupcakes, about 3.2"(âˆ…)x1.8"(H))
â–¡ 80g Eggs
â–¡ 75g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 5g Vanilla extract
â–¡ 1.5g Salt
â–¡ 120g Milk
â–¡ 8g Vegetable oil
â–¡ 160g Cake flour
â–¡ 6g Baking powder

â€¢ Before you start
Take your eggs and milk out of the fridge an hour before using.

â€¢ Notes
- I recommend using aluminum-free baking powder.
- Use neutral-flavored vegetable oil like corn or canola oil.
- Steaming time may vary depending on the size of your cupcake moulds or the type of stove you are using.
- You can use a hand whisk if you donâ€™t have a electric mixer.

â€¢ How to store
You can store the steamed cupcakes in the airtight container in the fridge or freezer. You can reheat in the microwave a little at a time until soft and warm. (Do not overheat, or it'll become hard.)

â€¢ Ingredients
For the biscuit base:
â–¡ 70g Oreos, crushed
â–¡ 30g Unsalted butter, melted

For the black sesame mousse:
â–¡ 200ml Heavy cream
â–¡ 220g Cream cheese
â–¡ 70g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 55g Plain yogurt
â–¡ 4g Lemon juice
â–¡ 6g Gelatin
â–¡ 80g Black sesame paste, divided(40g/40g)
â–¡ Black sesame seeds(for topping)

â€¢ Instructions
1. Crush the oreo cookies and add melted butter and mix
2. Place it in a cake tin and press evenly into the base of the cake tin
3. Refrigerate while preparing the cream cheese filling
4. Beat the cream cheese until it is smooth
5. Add sugar, plain yogurt, lemon juice, and melted gelatin and mix well
6. Whisk the heavy cream until thick and fold it into the cream cheese mixture
7. Pour a third of the amount of filling into the bottom of the mold and chill for 30 minutes
8. Put black sesame paste(40g) into the cream cheese mousse
9. Pour half of the black sesame mousse into the mold and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes
10. Add in black sesame paste(40g) and pour it into the cake
11. Chill in the fridge at least 4 hours to set
12. Remove the cake from the mold and top with black sesame seeds
13. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients
For the biscuit base:
â–¡ 65g Digestive biscuits, crushed
â–¡ 30g Unsalted butter, melted

For the cream cheese mousse:
â–¡ 200ml Heavy cream + 1tsp Granulated sugar
â–¡ 200g Cream cheese, at room temp
â–¡ 35g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 50g Plain yogurt, at room temp
â–¡ 1/4tsp Lemon juice
â–¡ 5g Gelatin
â–¡ 4g Matcha powderğŸŒ± + 8g Hot water
â–¡ Matcha powderğŸŒ±, for dusting
 
â€¢ Instructions
1. Crush the digestive biscuits and add melted butter and mix
2. Place it in a cake tin and press evenly into the base of the cake tin
3. Refrigerate while preparing the cream cheese filling
4. Beat the cream cheese until it is smooth
5. Add sugar, plain yogurt, lemon juice, and melted gelatin and mix well
6. Whisk the heavy cream until thick and fold it into the cream cheese mixture
7. Pour a third of the amount of filling into the bottom of the mold and chill for 30 minutes
8. Pour the remaining of the filling containing the matcha into the mold and chill in the fridge for at least 4 hours to set
9. Remove the cake from the mold and sprinkle top with matcha powder
10. Enjoy!

â–¡ 60g Granulated sugar

â–¡ 1tsp(5g) Lemon juice
â–¡ 6g Gelatin

â€¢ Instructions
1. Crush the Oreo cookies and add melted butter and mix
2. Place it in a cake tin and press evenly into the bottom of the cake tin
3. Refrigerate while preparing the cream cheese filling
4. Beat the cream cheese until it is smooth
5. Add in sugar, plain yogurt, vanilla extract and lemon juice
6. Stir in melted gelatin
6. Whisk the heavy cream until thickened and fold it into the cream cheese mixture

â€¢ Ingredients(size:15cm(Î¦)x5cm(H))
âˆ™ For the Crust:
60g Oreo crumbs
30g Unsalted butter, melted

âˆ™ For the Filling:
250g Cream cheese, softened
60g Granulated sugar
50g Plain yogurt
1 tsp Mint extract
1 tsp Lemon juice
2 and 1/2 sheets of Gelatin(5g)
1-2 drops of Blue&green gel food colouring
200ml Heavy cream, whipped

âˆ™ For the Topping(optional):
Whipped cream
Mini Oreo cookies

â€¢ Directions
1. In a bowl, add Oreo crumbs and melted butter, and stir until the crumbs are well-coated
2. Pour the mixture into the pan and press firmly into the bottom
3. Refrigerate the curst while making the cheesecake filling(for more than 30 min)
4. Whip heavy cream until thickened 
5. Beat the cream cheese until smooth and creamy
6. Add in granulated sugar, plain yogurt, mint extract, and lemon juice, and mix until well combined
7. Pour melted gelatin into the mixture and stir to combine(Note:Soak the sheet gelatin in cold water for 10 minutes. Once the sheet is softened, wring it out gently to remove excess water. Then microwave for 10 seconds until dissolved)
8. Add 1-2 drops of blue and green gel food colouring and mix well
9. Pour the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture and fold it in
10. Pour the filling into the crust and spread evenly with a spatula
11. Chill the cake for at least 3 hours
12. Remove the cake from the refrigerator
13. To remove the cake ring, heat it lightly with a hot towel or a torch
14. Pipe the whipped cream around the edge of the cake
15. Garnish with mini Oreo cookies
16. Bon appÃ©tit!

â€¢ Ingredients
2 slices of bread
5 fresh strawberries
1 Tbsp white vinegar(for sterilizing)
100ml heavy cream
10g granulated sugar

â€¢ Directions
1. Fill a large bowl with cool water and put strawberries into it
2. Add some white vinegar to the water for sterilizing
3. Let the berries sit in a vinegar-water bath for 2 minutes
4. Drain and rinse under running water and let them dry
5. Remove the stems from the berries
6. Put heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until stiff peaks form
7. Cut off the crusts of the bread
8. Spread whipped cream evenly on the bread and put strawberries on it
9. Spread some more whipped cream over strawberries
10. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes
11. Cut the sandwich in half diagonally to make triangle shapes
12. Serve with milk or coffee. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients
ğŸŒ¸For the biscuit base:
â–¡ 70g Digestive biscuits, crushed
â–¡ 35g Unsalted butter, melted

ğŸŒ¸For the cream cheese mousse:
â–¡ 150g Cream cheese
â–¡ 100ml Heavy cream
â–¡ 40g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 50g Plain yogurt
â–¡ 1/2tsp Lemon juice
â–¡ 1/2tsp Cherry blossom syrup
â–¡ 5g Gelatin

ğŸŒ¸For the cherry blossom jelly:
â–¡ 180ml Cherry blossom soda, heated
â–¡ 15g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 6g Gelatin
â–¡ Preserved cherry blossom
 ---------------------------------------------------------------------
â€¢ Instructions
1. Crush the digestive biscuits and mix with melted butter
2. Place it in a cake tin and press evenly into the base of the cake tin
3. Refrigerate while preparing the cream cheese filling
4. Beat the cream cheese until it is smooth
5. Add sugar, plain yogurt, lemon juice, cherry blossom syrup, and melted gelatin and mix well
6. Whisk the heavy cream until thick and fold it into the cream cheese mixture
7. Pour over the biscuit base and chill in fridge for an hour
8. Heat the cherry blossom soda and stir in sugar and melted gelatin
9. Pour half of the soda mixture over the mousse 
10. Put some preserved cherry blossoms and pour the remaining soda mixture
11. Chill in the fridge for 4 hours to set
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients
- Nutella Banana Roll-ups(yields:2 rolls):
2 slices of bread
1 Banana
2 tsp Nutella, to spread

- Banana Parfait(for a 500ml(2 cups) glass mug):
2 Tbsp Nutella
1 cup Granola
100g Plain yogurt
1 Banana, sliced
Whipped cream, for topping
Rolled wafers, for topping(as desired)
Lotus biscuits, for topping(as desired)
Lotus crumbs, for sprinkles(as desired)

â€¢ Directions
- Nutella Banana Roll-ups:
1. Cut the crusts off of each bread slice
2. Roll with a rolling pin to flatten
3. Spread Nutella thinly on each slice
4. Place a banana on top and roll up tightly
5. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap
6. Refrigerate for 30 minutes
7. Remove from the fridge and take off the plastic wrap
8. Cut into bite sized pieces. Enjoy!

- Banana Parfait
1. Put 2 Tbsp of Nutella into the bottom of the glass
2. Line the sides with thinly sliced bananas
3. Spoon a layer of plain yogurt
4. Add a layer of granola followed by banana slices
5. Repeat with another layer of each(until the glass is full)
6. Top it with whipped cream, banana slices, rolled wafers, and lotus biscuits
7. Finish with a sprinkle of Lotus crumbs. Enjoy!

â€¢ Servings: 16 square pieces
â€¢ Total time: 100 min

â€¢ This set includes:
100g dark chocolate
10g cocoa powder, for dusting
1 paper ribbon
1 gift box

â€¢ You need to prepare:
4 Tbsp heavy cream
1 tsp liqueur of your choice, optional
Hot water, at 176Â°F

â€¢ Before you start
1. Heat the water to 176Â°F
2. Fold the gift box
â€¢ Make sure that the bowls and utensils are perfectly dry

â€¢ Instructions
1. Pour the heavy cream into a bowl and place it over hot water at 176Â°F
2. Add the chocolate into the heated cream and stir until melted
3. Put the chocolate into the cold water bath and stir until creamy
4. Add liqueur of your choice and mix until combined
5. Pour the mixture into the baking tray and smooth the surface
6. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm
7. Remove the chocolate from the baking tray
8. Sift cocoa powder onto the tray
9. Cut the excess chocolate around the edges
(Warm up the knife with hot water and dry with a towel)
10. Cut the chocolate into 4 strips and cut them into cubes
11. Roll the chocolate using chopsticks to coat with cocoa powder
12. Put the chocolate in a box as a gift
13. Tie the box with a paper ribbon
14. Store in refrigerator up to 1 week

Ingredients(Pan size: 6â€³ x 3.5â€³)
For the Cake
â–¡ 115g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 100g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 45g Dark chocolateğŸ«
â–¡ 2 Large eggs(110g), at room temperature
â–¡ 90g Cake flour
â–¡ 30g Almond powder
â–¡ 18g Cocoa powder
â–¡ 4g Baking powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 35g Dark chocolate chips
â–¡ 30ml Milk, at room temperature
â–¡ 1/2tsp Chocolate liqueur(Optional)

For the Ganache Glaze
â–¡ 65g Heavy cream
â–¡ 80g Dark chocolateğŸ«

â€¢ Before you start
Take butter, eggs, and milk out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the butter until smooth and creamy
2. Whisk in granulated sugar until light and fluffy
3. Add in melted chocolate and mix well
4. Add eggs, little by little, beating after each addition
5. Sift the dry ingredients into the butter mixture and mix until just combined
6. Stir in chocolate chips, milk and chocolate liqueur
7. Put the batter into the greased pan
8. Bake for 30-35 min at 350Â°F
9. Let cool on the pan for 5-10 min and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely
10. Heat heavy cream in a microwave and put dark chocolate into the heated cream
11. Let stand for 2 minutes and stir until well blended
12. Drizzle the ganache glaze over the cooled cake
13. Decorate with the chopped pistachios
14. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(6(W)x2.7(L)x2.5(H) inch)
â–¡ 100g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 90g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 100g Eggs, at room temperature
â–¡ 100g Cake flour
â–¡ 15g Mugwort powder
â–¡ 1g Salt
â–¡ 3g Baking powder
â–¡ 30g Heavy cream, at room temperature

â—‡ Before You Start
â€¢ Take your butter, eggs, and heavy cream out of the fridge an hour before you begin baking
â€¢ Sift mugwort powder to filter its thick fibres before measuring

â€¢ Instructions
1. Beat the softened butter with sugar until light and fluffy
2. Add in a very small amount of the egg and beat after each addition
3. Sift together cake flour, mugwort powder, salt, and baking powder into the butter mixture
4. Mix until the dry ingredients are just combined(You can add some milk(10ml) if the batter is too stiff)
5. Stir in heavy cream
6. Place the batter into a greased cake pan
7. Using a spatula, make a concave surface
8. Pipe a vertical line of butter in the middle of the cake batter or score the top of the cake with a knife
9. Bake for 40 min at 340Â°F
10. Tap the cake pan on the countertop several times and take the cake out of the pan to cool completely
11. Top with a dollop of whipped cream
12. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(ğŸ° (Ã˜)15cm X (H)5cm)
For the biscuit base:
â–¡ 70g Digestive biscuits
â–¡ 30g Unsalted butter, melted

For the cheese filling:
â–¡ 2 Egg yolks
â–¡ 35g granulated sugar
â–¡ 170g Milk
â–¡ 1/2tsp Vanilla bean paste
â–¡ 5g Gelatin, melted
â–¡ 200g Cream cheese
â–¡ 150g Heavy cream + 15g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 2 Fresh figs, for topping

â€¢ Instructions
1. Crush the biscuits and add melted butter and mix
2. Place it in a cake tin and press evenly into the bottom of the cake tin
3. Refrigerate while preparing the cheese filling
4. Beat the cream cheese until it is smooth
5. Whisk egg yolks and sugar in a bowl to blend
6. Combine milk and vanilla paste in a saucepan
7. Stir over low heat until custard thickens
8. When it reaches about 175Â°F, remove from the heat
9. Stir in melted gelatin
10. Transfer custard into a bowl and let it cool down
11. Strain it into the softened cream cheese
12. Whisk the heavy cream until thickened and fold it into the cream cheese mixture
13. Pour the filling over the cooled crust and spread it into an even layer
14. Chill in the fridge at least 4 hours to set
15. Remove the cake from the mold and top with fresh figs
16. Enjoy!

â€¢ Instructions
1. Crush the oreo cookies and add melted butter and mix
2. Place it in a cake tin and press evenly into the base of the cake tin
3. Refrigerate while preparing the cream cheese filling
4. Beat the cream cheese until it is smooth
5. Add sugar, plain yogurt, lemon juice, and melted gelatin and mix well
6. Whisk the heavy cream until thick and fold it into the cream cheese mixture
7. Pour a third of the amount of filling into the bottom of the mold and chill for 30 minutes

10. Add in black sesame paste(40g) and pour it into the cake
11. Chill in the fridge at least 4 hours to set
12. Remove the cake from the mold and top with black sesame seeds
13. Enjoy!

â€¢ Ingredients(makes batch of 2 trays)
- For the carrot cake:
2 eggs
150ml vegetable oil
100ml boiling water
330g carrot cake premix
20g dried carrot chips
30g walnuts, chopped

- For the cream cheese frosting:
180g cream cheese
60g unsalted butter
50g powdered sugar
30g heavy cream

- Optional additions:
Walnuts, chopped
Cinnamon powder
Rosemary

â€¢ Instructions 
- To make the carrot cake:
1. Mix eggs, vegetable oil, soaked carrot chips, walnut and premix in a bowl and whisk until there are no lumps
2. Spread the cake mixture into the folded trays
3. Bake the trays in an oven(170, for 20-25 minutes) or in a 1,000W microwave(3 minutes 30 seconds)
4. Cool on a wire rack to serve
- To make the cream cheese frosting:
1. Beat softened cream cheese and butter until smooth and creamy
2. Add powdered sugar and heavy cream and mix until it gets fluffy
3. Top with chopped walnuts, cinnamon powder, and rosemary.

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 8 macarons)
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 46g almond flour 
â–¡ 42g powdered sugar
â–¡ 35g egg whites
â–¡ 33g granulated sugar
â–¡ 2g Earl grey tea leaves(1 tea bag)

For the Filling:
â–¡ 60g CrÃ¨me Anglaise
â–¡ 150ml Milk
â–¡ 80ml Heavy cream
â–¡ 35g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 2 bags of Earl grey tea leaves

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour, powdered sugar, and Earl grey tea leaves together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Sift the dry ingredients into the meringue and gently fold the mixture
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 0.4-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 1.4-inch circles
10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 30 minutes(for 40 min to an hour in a humid weather)
13. Bake for 8 min at 300Â°F and then for 5 min at 285Â°F (Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have)
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size

To Make the Filling:
1. Put milk, heavy cream and sugar into the sauce pan and simmer over medium heat 
2. Add in Earl Grey tea bags into the pan
3. Allow the tea to steep for 3 minutes and then remove the tea bags
4. Stir constantly until thickened
5. Once it has thickened enough, remove from the heat
6. Let it cool
7. Put Earl Grey spread into the CrÃ¨me Anglaise and mix well
8. Pipe the buttercream and refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

â€¢ Ingredients(makes a dozen macarons)
For the macaron shells: 
â–¡ 78g almond flour 
â–¡ 75g powdered sugar
â–¡ 60g egg whites, at room temperature 
â–¡ 60g granulated sugar
â–¡ Pink, red gel food colouring 

For the ganache filling:
â–¡ 70g dark chocolate
â–¡ 45g heavy cream
â–¡ 8g unsalted butter, softened

â€¢ Instructions 
To make the macaron shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Add 1-2 drops of pink gel food colouring and mix well
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Transfer some of the batter to another bowl to make 2-colour macarons
8. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
9. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 1/2 inch/wilton #5 round tip
10. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in hearts and small hearts in the middle
11. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles 
12. Let the macarons sit for 40 minutes(for 50 minutes to an hour in a humid weather)
13. Bake for 13 minutes at 150â„ƒ(302â„‰) *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have 
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size
15. Refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

To make the ganache filling:
1. Microwave dark chocolate and heavy cream together for 50 sec to 1min
2. Let stand for 2 min and stir until melted
3. Add in unsalted butter and mix well until smooth and glossy
4. Let it thicken enough to pipe the filling

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 8 macarons)
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 46g almond flour 
â–¡ 44g powdered sugar
â–¡ 35g egg whites
â–¡ 35g granulated sugar
â–¡ Black food colouring(Wilton Black)

For the Filling:
â–¡ 60g CrÃ¨me Anglaise
â–¡ 9g Black sesame paste
â–¡ 7g powdered black sesame
â–¡ Black sesame rice cake

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Add black gel food colouring and mix well
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 0.4-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 1.4-inch circles
10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 30 minutes
13. Bake for 13 minutes at 302â„‰ *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size

To Make the Filling:
1. Put black sesame paste and powder into the CrÃ¨me Anglaise and mix well
2. Pipe the buttercream round the perimeter of the macaron, leaving the centre empty
3. Put a black sesame rice cake into the centre
4. Refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

1. Beat cream cheese until smooth and creamy

10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles

For filling:

2. Add caramel syrup and mix until itâ€™s completely smooth

â€¢ Ingredients
For shells: 
46g almond flour 
44g powdered sugar 
35g egg whites, at room temperature 
35g granulated sugar

For filling:
80g dark chocolate
52g heavy cream
6g unsalted butter, softened 
2Tbsp nutella

â€¢ Instructions 
For shells: 
1. Sift almond flour, powdered sugar, and cocoa powder together 
2. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
3. Add the sugar and whisk until hard peaks form 
4. Fold the egg whites until well combined 
5. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
6. Place the batter into the piping bag 
7. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 3.5cm circles

For filling:

2. Add in softened butter and mix until well combined
3. Let the ganache cool completely
4. Pipe ganache blobs around the outside and fill the centre with nutella

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 8 macarons)
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 46g almond flour 
â–¡ 42g powdered sugar
â–¡ 35g egg whites
â–¡ 33g granulated sugar
â–¡ Pink & green food colouring

For the Filling:
â–¡ 40g Cream cheese, at room temperature
â–¡ 55g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 40g Powdered sugar
â–¡ 40g Blueberry jam(Adjust the amount to taste)

For the Blueberry jam:
â–¡ 100g Blueberry Puree
â–¡ 45g Granulated sugar
â–¡ 4g Lemon juice

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Sift the dry ingredients into the meringue and gently fold the mixture
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 0.4-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 1.4-inch circles
10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 30 minutes(for 40 min to an hour in a humid weather)
13. Bake for 8 min at 300Â°F and then for 5 min at 285Â°F (Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have)
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size

To Make the Filling:
1. In a mixing bowl, put cream cheese, butter, and powdered sugar and beat until well combined
2. Add in blueberry jam into the cream cheese mixture and mix well

â€¢ Ingredients
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 55g almond flour 
â–¡ 53g powdered sugar
â–¡ 42g egg whites
â–¡ 42g granulated sugar
â–¡ Pink food colouring 

For the Filling:
â–¡ 80g Italian buttercream
â–¡ 2g Strawberry powder or 2Tsp Strawberry jam
â–¡ 1/2tsp Cherry blossom syrup

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Add pink food colouring and mix well
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 0.4-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in a flower shape
10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 40 minutes(for 50 min to an hour in a humid weather)
13. Bake for 13 minutes at 302â„‰ *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size
15. Refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

To Make the Filling:
1. Beat the buttercream until soft and fluffy
2. Add strawberry powder(or jam) and cherry blossom syrup and mix well

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 8 macarons)
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 46g almond flour 
â–¡ 42g powdered sugar
â–¡ 35g egg whites
â–¡ 33g granulated sugar
â–¡ Purple & blue food colouring

For the Yogurt Filling:
â–¡ 60g Unsalted butter, at room temperature
â–¡ 15g powdered sugar(Adjust according to your taste)
â–¡ 20ml Heavy cream
â–¡ 30g Plain yogurt powder
â–¡ Fresh blueberries
â–¡ Bluberry jam

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Sift the dry mixture into the meringue
6. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 0.4-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 1.4-inch circles
10. Tap the pan 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop any remaining air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 30 minutes(for 40 min to an hour in a humid weather)
13. Bake for 8 min at 300Â°F and then for 5 min at 285Â°F (Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have)
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size

To Make the Yogurt Filling:
1. Add yogurt powder into the heated heavy cream and stir until fully dissolved
2. Place crÃ¨me anglaise, powdered sugar, the yogurt mixture in a bowl. Mix until well combined
3. Pipe the filling and refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

â€¢ Ingredients(makes 8 macarons)
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 46g almond flour 
â–¡ 44g powdered sugar
â–¡ 35g egg whites
â–¡ 35g granulated sugar
â–¡ Green(wilton moss green)&black food colouring 

For the Filling:
â–¡ 70g CrÃ¨me Anglaise
â–¡ 5g mugwort powder(Add more, if you want)
â–¡ 5g bean powder(Add more, if you want)

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Add gel food colouring and mix well
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 0.4-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet
10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 40 minutes(for 50 min to an hour in a humid weather)
13. Bake for 13 minutes at 302â„‰ *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size

To Make the Filling:
1. Put mugwort/bean powder into crÃ¨me anglaise and mix well
2. Pipe the filling onto half of the cooled macarons
3. Refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

â€¢ Ingredients
For shells: 
46g almond flour 
44g powdered sugar 
35g egg whites, at room temperature 
35g granulated sugar 
2-3 drops of blue&green food colouring(any colour you desire) 

For filling:
80g anglaise buttercream
40g cream cheese
1/4tsp mint extract
2Tbsp oreo crumbs

â€¢ Instructions 
For shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together 
2. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
3. Add the sugar and whisk until hard peaks form 
4. Fold the egg whites until well combined 
5. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
6. Place the batter into the piping bag 
7. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 3.5cm circles 
8. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles 
9. Let the macarons sit for at least 30 minutes(for 50 minutes to an hour in a humid weather) 
10. Bake for 13 minutes at 150â„ƒ(302â„‰) *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have 
11. Remove from the oven and let them cool 
12. Refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

For filling:
1. Beat softened buttercream and cream cheese until smooth and creamy.
2. Add mint extract and oreo crumbs and mix until well combined

â€¢ Ingredients
For the Macaron Shells: 
â–¡ 46g almond flour 
â–¡ 44g powdered sugar
â–¡ 35g egg whites
â–¡ 35g granulated sugar
â–¡ A few drops of green&brown gel food colouring 

For the Filling:
â–¡ 70g Italian buttercream
â–¡ 3g Matcha powder
â–¡ Dark chocolate chips

â€¢ Instructions 
To Make the Macaron Shells: 
1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. Set aside.
2. Beat the egg whites at low speed until foamy
3. Beat the egg whites with sugar until soft peaks form 
4. Add the remaining sugar and whisk until hard peaks form
5. Add a few drops of green&brown gel food colouring and mix well
6. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue
7. Macaronage *Be careful not to overmix or undermix the batter 
8. Place the batter into the piping bag fitted with a 1/5-inch round tip
9. Pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in 1.4-inch circles
10. Tap the pan against the counter 2~3 times to flatten the macarons and to remove air bubbles
11. Pop air bubbles with a toothpick
12. Let the macarons sit for 40 minutes(for 50 min to an hour in a humid weather)
13. Bake for 13 minutes at 302â„‰ *Time and temperature vary depending on which type of oven you have
14. Let them cool completely and pair macarons of similar size
15. Pipe the buttercream filling onto half of the cooled macarons
16. Refrigerate for a few hours to allow the filling to set

To Make the Filling:
1. Beat the buttercream until it is smooth and creamy
2. Add matcha powder and mix well
3. Pipe the buttercream filling onto half of the macarons
4. Put some chocolate chips on the filling
